creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: gnarled pine near center with curving trunk; small stone near R of tree trunk; inscription 2nd from R panel
markings: poem UR red seal: 師在我 {shi zai ga}; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #6], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #6]
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair
signed: 昭和七年十月吉　南海一布衣古人詩畫 {Shōwa shichinen jūgatsu kichi Nankai-ichi hōi Kojin shiga} (A lucky day in October 1932, poetry and painting by One-of-the-Southern-Sea in Plain-Clothes Kojin) left
text:
愛此老松樹　
自存君子姿　
有時明月夜　
仙鶴來宿枝
I just love this old tree!
How it preserves the demeanor of a gentleman!
At times, on moonlit nights,
Immortal cranes come to spend the night on its branches.
title: Old Pines
